item.description:
I have arranged to have an Astronomical Presentation at the Sutton Library on Wednesday, September 30th starting at 6:45 PM for the Oxford Astronomy Meetup Group. The full name of the library is the Sutton Free Public Library located at 4 Uxbridge Rd Sutton, MA 01590. The topic will be Backyard Astronomy : Sucessful Starhopping under Sutton Starry Skies! I will present a 45 minute overview of successful backyard astronomy techniques for beginners using binoculars or a small telescope through a series of PowerPoint slides.

It will be open to the public but will have plenty of room for all Oxford Astronomy Group Members who would like to attend! I will also bring some great handouts from NASA and the Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc. for all who attend. There will be plenty of time for questions and discussions.

After the meeting, I will set up a telescope behind the library and will invite members to bring their own binoculars or telescopes for a shared outdoor viewing experience if the weather permits. We will also be able to discuss future meetup events for this group throughout the area. I can also talk about Aldrich Astronomical Society, Inc. upcoming events which members might also be interested in attending.
item.how_to_find_us: Just enter the library and ask the librarians,. I believe we will be meeting in the same room as last time when we met in a large room in one of the upper floors.
item.name: The Oxford Astronomy Meetup Group
